pros: Nice environment to work in. Social security benefits of Austria.
cons: Nothing really if you like what you are doing.

review_title: A good place for a short time
pros: High end equipment. Pro-active employees. Can use all the equipment yourself
cons: Bonuses are not allowed. Outstanding performance is not recognized

pros: - Academically exceptionally strong research institute. - Professors are leading experts in their fields (at least in computer science, which is my field). - Attractive salary compared to other PhD programs.
cons: - The institute is quite remote, it is on the outskirts of Klosterneuburg. However, IST provides frequent shuttle transport to/from Klosterneuburg and Vienna.

review_title: Good place to do science, still can improve
pros: Friendly and diverse environment, high quality research and ambitious PIs. Fully funded PhD program, with a 5-year contract. Rotation system in the first year.
cons: The daily commute from Vienna (45-60 mins), issues with the shuttle bus and overbearing management/facility managers. Inefficient conflict management system and overall disregard for employees' voices/opinions.

pros: Multidisciplinary, excellent core facilities, internal collaborations
cons: A bit isolated from the rest of the scientific community in Vienna

pros: Lab and project of my choice
cons: As a post doc one cannot apply independent grants

review_title: Great place to grow as an academic
pros: Diverse and inclusive work environment
cons: Not much career support for leaving academia

pros: Competitive environment, experienced professors and students
cons: Small number of professors and students

pros: Freedom to do the research you are interested in while surrounded by amazing people
cons: It depends on your tastes but the commuting time could be a hassle.

job_title: PhD Student In Computer Science in Vienna
pros: Top quality research with some world class faculty. The institute is fast growing. The salary and benefits are competitive compared to other graduate programs.
cons: Remote location, located in a town called Klosterneuburg. For people based in Vienna, the commute can take up to 1 hour per direction.

pros: Modern, well-equipped, excellent science, multi-disciplinary, beautiful location, free coffee, free workshops for career development, science outreach, great instagram account
cons: Limit of 5 years for postdoc, administration doesn't care about scientists, male-dominated leadership

pros: Interdisciplinarity, friendly and relaxed environment
cons: Quite far from the city center of Vienna

pros: Best place to do science
cons: A little far from Vienna

pros: An absolutely superb place for pure academic research. The salaries are high (for academia), the academic atmosphere is very professional and the working conditions and equipment and world-class. The social atmosphere is also extremely good.
cons: Some of the research groups are still relatively isolated from the others in the sense that they are the only one on campus focusing on a certain topic. However, this is slowly improving as the institute grows.

pros:
* family-friendly employer
* interesting projects and topics
* growing and dynamic environment
* top supervisors and nice team
* modern infrastructure
cons: * commute, if you live in Vienna

pros: Vibrant, diverse, welcoming and very international student community, beautiful campus in a pleasant and quiet neighbourhood, state of the art labs and machines, grant office provides an immense help with grant applications.
cons: The commute from Vienna (Heiligenstadt) takes 25 minutes. As a PhD student, your wellbeing is completely dependent on your supervisor.

pros:
i) Well organized
ii) Competent HR
iii) Good research environment
cons:
i) Very new institute, so not sure about the reputation
ii) Lack of diversity
iii) Though well connected to Vienna, there's nothing much nearby

review_title: Great environment to do world class science
pros: World-class academic research environment with state of the art core facilities. Many of the staff scientists in the core facilities go above and beyond to ensure the success of your experiments. IST Austria is a bit of an oasis in the world of academic science. There are seemingly unlimited resources to do science here. The only limitation is your motivation.
cons: Quite a bit of bureaucracy and ideas from postdocs to improve the workplace are often ignored. There is definitely a disconnect between scientists and admin which could be improved.

pros: Great atmosphere, and a bar on campus!
cons: A bit far from Vienna

pros: Really great place, management very efficient and supportive, access to scientific excellence.
cons: As always with academic jobs, postdoc contracts are only for a limited time.

pros: State of the art research, good infrastructure, competitive salary
cons: You have to remote from Vienna

pros: Top environment with nice people
cons: No major ones identified thus far

pros: Grants many opportunities to learn outside of your field. Fosters interdisciplinary collaborations.
cons: Only limited number of research groups for specific areas.

pros: state of the art equipment and lots of support - media kitchen, imaging facility, mailing lists for questions
cons: management sometimes confusing, and makes you feel like you have no say

pros: Very interdisciplinary atmosphere. Great opportunity to learn and interact with top scientist world-wide. Good salary for a student.
cons: With time it becomes more crowded and bureaucracy grows.

pros: Excellent facilities, but the actual conditions depend significantly on the exact unit.
cons: Far from the city. Huge bureaucracy, probably typical for Europe.

pros: Young professors, freedom, free shuttle buses from Vienna, a lot of events
cons: Located in a country-side, campus is small compared to universities

review_title: Extremely satisfied with my computer science PhD
pros: Extremely satisfied with my computer science PhD
cons: None come to my mind for computer science

pros: One of the top world wide institute
cons: Location outside the city is not most convenient, but very nice place

pros: Great environment, great professors and colleagues
cons: Isolated in the area of Klosterneuburg

pros: None really I liked it
cons: A lot of work for one persons

pros: International outlook, attractive yearly bonus, flexible work times
cons: Zero career progression, library not mature enough
